title: How to Make an Easy Apple Pie

steps.headline: Collect the ingredients and wash your hands.
Flour a wooden board or a clean cloth, and put half the the biscuit dough on it.
Roll out the biscuit dough to the size of the pie pan, then roll out the rest of the dough into a round of equal size.
Peel, core, and slice the apples.
steps.description: Leave them in slices or cube them according to your preference.

steps.headline: Place one dough round into the pie pan, making sure to avoid wrinkles.
steps.description: Add the apples and some butter.

steps.headline: Add the next round of dough for the top crust, and press the edges together.
steps.description: Cut slits in the crust for the steam to escape. Sprinkle some cinnamon and sugar on top.

steps.headline: Put your pie into the oven.
steps.description: Bake for the length indicated on the biscuit dough can.

text: Collect the ingredients and wash your hands. Preheat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C). Flour a wooden board or a clean cloth, and put half the the biscuit dough on it.  Roll out the biscuit dough to the size of the pie pan, then roll out the rest of the dough into a round of equal size. Grease the pie pan. Peel, core, and slice the apples. Leave them in slices or cube them according to your preference. Place one dough round into the pie pan, making sure to avoid wrinkles. Add the apples and some butter. Add the next round of dough for the top crust, and press the edges together. Cut slits in the crust for the steam to escape. Sprinkle some cinnamon and sugar on top. Put your pie into the oven. Bake for the length indicated on the biscuit dough can. Allow your pie to cool. Enjoy your simple homemade pie. Finished.
